A Brief History of APIs Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(6) Technological History



A Brief History of APIs Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(7) 2000s: The Programmable Web

  • 1989 [https://www.w3.org/Protocols/HTTP/AsImplemented.html]: HTTP created for resource-oriented interactions
  • 1998 [https://www.w3.org/TR/1998/REC-xml-19980210]: XML created as language for machine-readable data
  • 1999 [https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/archive/msdn-magazine/2000/april/cutting-edge-exchanging-data-over-the-internet-using-xml]: Scripting becomes network-capable
  • Scripting and Web 2.0 [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_2.0] drive the growth of networked apps
  • Enterprise follows the dynamism and path of the web
  • 2007/2008 [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPhone]: Mobile arrives and boosts API significance


A Brief History of APIs Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(8) Programmable Web: 97 APIs in 2005



A Brief History of APIs Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(9) 2010s: Digital Transformation

  • Moving from digital interfaces to digital business processes
  • APIs become the backbone for mobile, cloud, and SaaS integration
  • Rise of platform thinking: internal reuse, partner ecosystems, data leverage
  • Investment in governance, security, and lifecycle management to scale APIs


A Brief History of APIs Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(10) 2020s: AI the APIs

  • AI affects the consumer and provider sides of APIs
  • APIs for AI consumption: Contracts need to change
  • AI for API management: More/different tools in the API lifecycle
  • AI Optionality: AI needs space to explore and experiment


API Business Models

Outline (API Business Models)

  1. A Brief History of APIs [5]
  2. API Business Models [8]
API Business Models Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(12) Become Platform-y

  • Most businesses are not (primarily) API businesses
  • Many businesses can benefit from adding an API angle
  • Explore API Business Models [https://www.mulesoft.com/sites/default/files/cmm_files/2020_Guide_to_API_Business_Models.pdf] for some inspiration


API Business Models Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(18) The 900lb Gorilla



API Business Models Erik Wilde: Overview of APIs and API Business Models

(19) Most API Value Creation is Indirect

  1. Using APIs to become better at internal reuse and cross-pollination
  2. Reducing friction by having teams communicate via APIs
  3. Using API First as a way to build everything as digital building blocks
